title: Boeing Still Says 737 MAX to Fly by Year-End, but Profits Will Fall
text:
There were no new negative surprises in Boeing’s third-quarter earnings release, and that was enough to send shares higher in Wednesday trading. More details about cash flow, profits, and the 737 MAX are emerging as management speaks with analysts on their quarterly conference call. Here’s what management is saying.

737 MAX

The company maintains its timeline for the 737 MAX’s return to service by the end of this year. That’s probably the number one takeaway from Wednesday’s news release and conference call. Boeing (ticker:...
description: There were no new negative surprises in Boeing’s third-quarter earnings release, sending the stock higher. Boeing is sticking to its timeline for the 737 MAX.
